page.title: 0833 ENGINEER REGIMENT EOD
page.content: The largest bomb 33 Regiment has had to deal with was an 1,800 kilogram bomb. Units of 33 Regiment are often requested to go to different parts of the world. Recent tours have included Hong Kong, Solomon Islands, Bahamas and the Channel Islands. There is now a permanent detachment in the Falkland Islands.A lot of 33 Regiments day to day work is in the dangerous task of clearing training areas to make them safe for handing back to the public sector. Most of the equipment used by 33 Regiment is highly specialised. They have equipment capable of detecting explosive devices underground, special equipment for digging down to the bomb and of course special tools for making the bomb safe and removing the explosives. Their job is very dangerous most of the time and especially so in winter.
